intro: Promenaea paranaensis var. albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered paranaensis, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking white petals and velvety leaves. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers are tubular and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is often cultivated in botanical gardens for conservation and ornamental purposes.
